|latNS = N |longd = 95 |longm = 34 |longs = 47 |longEW = W <!-- Area/postal codes & others --> |postal_code_type = |postal_code = |area_code = |blank_name = [[Federal Information Processing Standard|FIPS code]] |blank_info = 27-05302{{GR|2}} |blank1_name = [[Geographic Names Information System|GNIS]] feature ID |blank1_info = 0663573{{GR|3}} |website = |footnotes = }} '''Ben Wade Township''' is a township in [[Pope County, Minnesota|Pope County]], [[Minnesota]], [[United States]]. The population was 252 at the 2000 census. ==Geography== According to the [[United States Census Bureau]], the township has a total area of 35.4 mi² (91.7 km²); 34.0 mi² (88.1 km²) of it is land and 1.4 mi² (3.6 km²) of it (3.95%) is water. ==Demographics== As of the [[census]]{{GR|2}} of 2000, there were 252 people, 88 households, and 68 families residing in the township. The [[population density]] was 7.4/mi² (2.9/km²). There were 95 housing units at an average density of 2.8/mi² (1.1/km²). The racial makeup of the township was 98.81% [[White (U.S. Census)|White]], 0.40% [[African American (U.S. Census)|African American]], 0.40% [[Native American (U.S. Census)|Native American]], and 0.40% from two or more races. There were 88 households out of which 38.6% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 72.7% were [[Marriage|married couples]] living together, and 22.7% were non-families. 21.6% of all households were made up of individuals and 8.0% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.86 and the average family size was 3.37. In the township the population was spread out with 30.6% under the age of 18, 7.9% from 18 to 24, 30.2% from 25 to 44, 21.4% from 45 to 64, and 9.9% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 34 years. For every 100 females there were 115.4 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 124.4 males. The median income for a household in the township was $36,458, and the median income for a family was $45,278. Males had a median income of $30,469 versus $18,750 for females. The [[per capita income]] for the township was $14,500. About 9.5% of families and 12.5% of the population were below the [[poverty line]], including 14.8% of those under the age of eighteen and none of those sixty five or over. ==References== {{reflist}} {{Pope County, Minnesota}} [[Category:Townships in Pope County, Minnesota]]
